title: Ticket #1986: procd_ctl and gidd_alloc include unnecessary deps
description:
Right now, the client tools for procd link against ${CONDOR_TOOL_LIBS}. This is a huge amount of extra code brought into something that should be simple. Particularly, if built in proper mode, this brings in Globus, VOMS, SSL, KRB5, etc.

Patch is simple and included below.

As procd_ctl brings in a good number of large deps, the resulting binary still has a large amount of code (3.4MB for the procd_ctl client; 686KB for the procd itself). Pete may want to review this: none of the Condor dependencies look "essential".
remarks:
2011-Mar-30 14:16:08 by psilord:
With this patch, does the procd_ctl still compile?

2011-Jul-07 20:18:33 by bbockelm:
Hi Pete,

I believe it did at the time. However, the idea is pretty simple - strip out any DC stuff.

Todd - I'd like to bump up the priority of this one. In Fedora, we are planning on producing a condor-procd subpackage for folks (think glexec tracking plugin) that don't want the full thing, only this useful stand-alone subset.

Thanks,

Brian

2013-Apr-01 07:37:54 by bbockelm:
A fix was pushed for this.

As a part of the fix, the "-A" argument for procd_ctl is now mandatory (this was necessary to remove the dependency on the param subsystem). I checked with the only user of procd_ctl I know of, the OSG, and this argument is already always passed.

2013-Apr-01 08:42:27 by gthain:
Looks good to me, assuming there's no other users of the procd who need the config file.

2013-Apr-01 08:50:14 by bbockelm:
To be clear - the change was for dropping the param subsystem involves "procd_ctl", not "procd". The userbase of procd_ctl has a much smaller surface area.
